fullText: Owen brings a compelling mixture of arrogance and vulnerability to the role of Rene Gallimard, the French diplomat who falls in love with what he believes is a Chinese opera singer.

bwwExcerpt: Taymor has shielded Hwang's poetry from being overwhelmed by the sheer theatricality of the story, which was based on a real-life case. In one of the playwright's many ravishing lines, Gallimard embraces his fate because "I have known - and been loved by - the perfect woman." By fortifying the scenes that frame the love story, Taymor has also strengthened the political undercurrents of the play.
